title: Participles
description: Слушайте причастные обороты и определяйте их значение.

tasks.audioText: The journalist was reporting from the scene of the accident. Walking through the wreckage, she noticed a piece of evidence that investigators had overlooked.
tasks.transcript: Walking through the wreckage, she noticed a piece of evidence that investigators had overlooked.

options.text: While she was walking through the debris, she found something the investigators missed.
The investigators found the evidence before the journalist arrived.
She was walking away from the wreckage when investigators arrived.
The journalist refused to walk through the accident scene.

tasks.explanation: 'Walking through the wreckage' is a present participle clause showing simultaneous action — she was walking and noticed evidence.

tasks.audioText: The museum had a remarkable collection of art. The painting stolen from the gallery in 1990 was finally recovered during a police raid last month.
tasks.transcript: The painting stolen from the gallery in 1990 was finally recovered during a police raid last month.

options.text: The police stole a painting from the gallery in 1990.
A painting that had been taken from the gallery in 1990 was found again in a recent raid.
The gallery recovered the painting before the police raid.
The painting was stolen during the police raid last month.

tasks.explanation: 'Stolen from the gallery' is a past participle acting as a reduced relative clause modifying 'the painting'.

tasks.audioText: The architect presented her final design to the committee. Having considered all the structural constraints, she proposed an innovative solution using sustainable materials.
tasks.transcript: Having considered all the structural constraints, she proposed an innovative solution using sustainable materials.

options.text: She proposed the solution before considering the structural limitations.
After taking all structural limitations into account, she suggested a creative eco-friendly design.
The committee proposed the innovative solution to the architect.
She rejected sustainable materials due to structural constraints.

tasks.explanation: 'Having considered' is a perfect participle indicating a completed action before the main clause. She thought first, then proposed.

tasks.audioText: The rescue operation was complex and dangerous. Exhausted by the twelve-hour search, the firefighters finally located the missing hikers near the summit.
tasks.transcript: Exhausted by the twelve-hour search, the firefighters finally located the missing hikers near the summit.

options.text: The hikers were exhausted after searching for the firefighters.
The firefighters gave up the search after twelve hours.
Although worn out from searching for twelve hours, the firefighters found the lost hikers close to the top.
The missing hikers located the firefighters near the summit.

tasks.explanation: 'Exhausted by' is a past participle clause describing the firefighters' state while they completed the rescue.

tasks.audioText: The entrepreneur gave an inspiring keynote speech. Speaking from personal experience, he encouraged young founders to embrace failure as a stepping stone to success.
tasks.transcript: Speaking from personal experience, he encouraged young founders to embrace failure as a stepping stone to success.

options.text: Drawing on his own life lessons, he urged new entrepreneurs to view setbacks as opportunities for growth.
The young founders spoke about their personal experiences with failure.
He warned young founders that failure would destroy their businesses.
Someone else's experience was the basis for his speech.

tasks.explanation: 'Speaking from personal experience' is a present participle clause indicating the manner in which he delivered his advice.

tasks.audioText: The company was preparing for its annual audit. The documents submitted by the finance department contained several discrepancies that required immediate attention.
tasks.transcript: The documents submitted by the finance department contained several discrepancies that required immediate attention.

options.text: The finance department's paperwork had no errors whatsoever.
The audit revealed that the finance team's documents had inconsistencies needing urgent review.
The documents were submitted after the discrepancies were resolved.
The company submitted documents to the finance department.

tasks.explanation: 'Submitted by the finance department' is a past participle phrase modifying 'documents'. The errors needed quick resolution.

tasks.audioText: The detective reviewed the crime scene meticulously. Not having found any fingerprints, she concluded that the burglar had worn gloves throughout the entire operation.
tasks.transcript: Not having found any fingerprints, she concluded that the burglar had worn gloves throughout the entire operation.

options.text: The detective found fingerprints at the crime scene.
Because no fingerprints were discovered, the detective determined the thief had used gloves the whole time.
The burglar left gloves at the crime scene.
The detective wore gloves while examining the crime scene.

tasks.explanation: 'Not having found' is a negative perfect participle showing that the absence of fingerprints led to her conclusion about gloves.

tasks.audioText: The university organised a welcome event for international students. Surrounded by unfamiliar faces, the exchange student from Brazil felt overwhelmed but determined to make friends.
tasks.transcript: Surrounded by unfamiliar faces, the exchange student from Brazil felt overwhelmed but determined to make friends.

options.text: The Brazilian student knew everyone at the welcome event.
Being among strangers, the Brazilian exchange student was anxious yet resolved to socialise.
The exchange student left the event because she felt overwhelmed.
Familiar faces surrounded the exchange student at the event.

tasks.explanation: 'Surrounded by unfamiliar faces' is a past participle clause describing the student's situation, followed by mixed emotions.

tasks.audioText: The environmental report was presented to parliament. Containing alarming data about deforestation rates, the report prompted the government to announce emergency conservation measures.
tasks.transcript: Containing alarming data about deforestation rates, the report prompted the government to announce emergency conservation measures.

options.text: The government announced conservation measures before seeing the report.
The report showed positive trends in forest preservation.
Because the report included disturbing deforestation statistics, the government declared urgent conservation actions.
Parliament rejected the environmental report entirely.

tasks.explanation: 'Containing alarming data' is a present participle clause giving the reason why the government reacted with emergency measures.

tasks.audioText: The surgeon had a long day in the operating theatre. Having performed three complex surgeries back to back, Dr. Williams decided to postpone the remaining consultations until the following morning.
tasks.transcript: Having performed three complex surgeries back to back, Dr. Williams decided to postpone the remaining consultations until the following morning.

options.text: Dr. Williams completed all consultations before the surgeries.
After completing three consecutive difficult operations, the doctor chose to delay further appointments to the next day.
Dr. Williams cancelled all surgeries due to exhaustion.
The remaining consultations were performed that same evening.

tasks.explanation: 'Having performed' is a perfect participle showing completed action before the decision to postpone.

tasks.audioText: The negotiations between the two companies were tense. Realising that neither side would compromise, the mediator suggested a forty-eight-hour cooling-off period.
tasks.transcript: Realising that neither side would compromise, the mediator suggested a forty-eight-hour cooling-off period.

options.text: Both sides quickly reached a compromise during the negotiations.
The mediator refused to intervene in the tense negotiations.
When the mediator understood that no agreement was possible, she recommended a two-day break.
The companies suggested the cooling-off period to the mediator.

tasks.explanation: 'Realising that neither side would compromise' is a present participle clause showing the mediator's reasoning behind the suggestion.

tasks.audioText: The concert was a major cultural event in the city. Written by a relatively unknown composer, the symphony received a standing ovation from the audience at its premiere.
tasks.transcript: Written by a relatively unknown composer, the symphony received a standing ovation from the audience at its premiere.

options.text: A famous composer wrote the symphony that received a standing ovation.
The audience disliked the symphony at its first performance.
Although composed by a little-known musician, the piece earned enthusiastic applause at its debut.
The symphony had been performed many times before this concert.

tasks.explanation: 'Written by a relatively unknown composer' is a past participle clause contrasting the composer's obscurity with the symphony's success.

tasks.audioText: The climate scientist presented her findings at the conference. Analysing decades of satellite imagery, the research team discovered that glacial retreat had accelerated far beyond initial projections.
tasks.transcript: Analysing decades of satellite imagery, the research team discovered that glacial retreat had accelerated far beyond initial projections.

options.text: By studying years of satellite data, the researchers found that glaciers were melting much faster than originally predicted.
The satellite imagery showed that glaciers were growing unexpectedly.
The research team refused to analyse satellite imagery.
Glacial retreat matched the initial projections exactly.

tasks.explanation: 'Analysing decades of satellite imagery' is a present participle clause describing the method that led to the alarming discovery.

tasks.audioText: The old mansion had been abandoned for years. Covered in thick ivy and surrounded by overgrown gardens, the estate still retained a haunting beauty that attracted photographers.
tasks.transcript: Covered in thick ivy and surrounded by overgrown gardens, the estate still retained a haunting beauty that attracted photographers.

options.text: The estate was well-maintained with neatly trimmed gardens.
Photographers avoided the abandoned mansion completely.
Despite being overgrown with ivy and wild gardens, the property maintained an eerie charm that drew photographers.
The thick ivy and gardens were recently planted around the mansion.

tasks.explanation: 'Covered... and surrounded...' are two past participle clauses describing the estate's neglected yet beautiful appearance.

tasks.audioText: The startup held an all-hands meeting to discuss strategy. Having secured a major investment from a Silicon Valley venture capital firm, the CEO announced plans to expand into three new international markets.
tasks.transcript: Having secured a major investment from a Silicon Valley venture capital firm, the CEO announced plans to expand into three new international markets.

options.text: The CEO announced expansion plans before receiving any investment.
The startup was planning to exit international markets entirely.
After obtaining significant funding from a Silicon Valley firm, the CEO revealed international expansion into three markets.
The venture capital firm announced its own expansion plans.

tasks.explanation: 'Having secured' is a perfect participle showing the investment was obtained before the expansion announcement was made.

short_description: Причастные обороты: настоящие, прошедшие и перфектные.
